page.title: 17A day at The Elms School
page.content: At 7.30 on a summer's morning we awake, summoned by the bell. Compulsory exercise, that makes us feel even more tired, is followed by breakfast and then the quiet of Chapel. Seven periods of teaching spread over a typical day, which we like or dislike in varying degrees, are separated by the pleasures of eating, the joy or misery of games, and free time which is popular with all. It sounds commonplace and uninteresting, but there are moments that stick in the memory; of achievement, of failure even, of friendships made. The day passes. The seniors hear the 9 o'clock news and then all is, or should be, quiet. Are we happy? Most of us feel reasonably so; but as the day of leaving approaches, hardly any say good-bye with more than a twinge of regret.
